description: Configures UI branding settings for domains with the hosted UI (classic) branding version. Your user pool must have a domain. Configure a domain with . Set the default configuration for all clients with a ClientId of ALL. When the ClientId value is an app client ID, the settings you pass in this request apply to that app client and override the default ALL configuration.

parameters.name: UserPoolId
parameters.description: The ID of the user pool where you want to apply branding to the classic hosted UI.

nested_items.name: UICustomization
nested_items.description: Information about the hosted UI branding that you applied.

nested_items.name: UserPoolId
nested_items.description: The ID of the user pool with hosted UI customizations.

nested_items.name: ClientId
nested_items.description: The app client ID for your UI customization. When this value isn't present, the customization applies to all user pool app clients that don't have client-level settings..

nested_items.name: ImageUrl
nested_items.description: A URL path to the hosted logo image of your UI customization.

nested_items.name: CSS
nested_items.description: The CSS values in the UI customization.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedDate
nested_items.description: The date and time when the item was modified. Amazon Cognito returns this timestamp in UNIX epoch time format. Your SDK might render the output in a human-readable format like ISO 8601 or a Java Date object.

nested_items.name: CreationDate
nested_items.description: The date and time when the item was created. Amazon Cognito returns this timestamp in UNIX epoch time format. Your SDK might render the output in a human-readable format like ISO 8601 or a Java Date object.
